newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ETFC GROUP PLANS EXPANSION TO UKRAINE - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: ETFC GROUP PLANS EXPANSION TO UKRAINE - REPORT.

text.p: ETFC Group, a company with holdings in several food processing companies in Estonia, is planning to open two representative offices in Ukraine, Aripaev business newspaper said on Tuesday.

ETFC has holdings in Rakvere meat plant , Kalev confectioner , Tallinn milk processing factory, Tartu cold storage, Kalur Fisheries and Epeks Production, a soft drink manufacturer, the newspaper added.
ETFC group chairman Ants Laos said after a recent visit to Ukraine that the group plans to open one representation in Kiev and another in western Ukraine, the newspaper said.
The expected cost of establishing the representative offices will be six to seven million kroons, but the company is looking at the market in two to three years time.
"I believe that in the next two to three years interesting things could happen there," Laos was quoted as saying by Aripaev.
